project
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  project.Controller

public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

The controller is the main class This is where all of the real work happens It creates the view and decides what will be added All interaction takes place through this class

Version:
9.0
Author:
Anthony Scata

Nested Class Summary
 class Controller.Clear_Button_Action
          The clear button action listener Perform the correct clear action when a button is pressed Only clear the panel corresponding to the button
 class Controller.ComboBox_Action
          This listens to the combo box's and performs an action
(package private)  class Controller.Interaction_Mouse_Listener
          The mouse listener that controls the mouse clicking and hovering
 class Controller.KeyPress_Action
          Listen to the keyboard and if a button is pressed then perform an action This deals with the search box and making sure action are performed when keys are typed Also we have the ability to move the panel up and down
 class Controller.Scroll_adjust_listener
          This method is called whenever the value of a scrollbar is changed, either by the user or automatically.

          Add the contents to the panels These defines what part of the visualisation goes where While doing this we also make sure that interaction can not occur by placing a panel over the frame

          A generic count for the codes We have the id of what we are searching and we will return its count
 double Alpha_table(int hierarchy_num)
          Add the top level values to the visualisation Calls the Alpha_codes_middle method to add the rest of the visualisation
 void connection(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> list, Hierarchy h3)
          This method makes the connection between the levels This way if we interact with one panel then the rest will light up and show data As we have three panels, just need to perform the operations on the other two
 void count(java.lang.String option)
          Update the counter / bar on all of the panels This occurs when an event is fired that changes the type of count As this is global all of the counts will be the same
 java.lang.StringBuffer from_to(java.lang.StringBuffer inputs, java.lang.String from, java.lang.String to)
          Decides which query to be run when we have a starting set (the from) and the table we want to get to (the to) We decide which query we will use depending on the count type that is currently being used

 void largest(int index)
          Gets the code with the largest count We are only interested in the number not the actual code A different query is formed based on the number of levels the table has

Constructor Detail

Controller

public Controller(Java_Connector model,
                  View view,
                  QueryView query)
The constructor for the controller It sets up the visualisation

Parameters:
model - - The one model used for this visualisation, namely the connector
view - - The view or interface that the user sees
query - - The custom query view that can be created by the user
Method Detail

add_contents_to_view

public boolean add_contents_to_view()
Add the contents to the panels These defines what part of the visualisation goes where While doing this we also make sure that interaction can not occur by placing a panel over the frame

Returns:
- The result of the adding of the contents, indicating an error or success

add_listeners

public void add_listeners()
Add the listeners to the objects in the view that allow interaction These include the search box, combo box and panel operations

addLabel

public AMLabel addLabel(java.lang.String id,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        Hierarchy hierarchy,
                        int level,
                        java.lang.String parent)
Generic adder function Takes away some of the duplicate code that is required to add contents to the different hierarchies

Parameters:
id - - the unique id of the object
name - - the name of the object
hierarchy - - the hierarchy that it belongs to
level - - the level in that hierarchy
parent - - the parent id of this object
Returns:
- the label that is created

Alpha_table

public double Alpha_table(int hierarchy_num)
Add the top level values to the visualisation Calls the Alpha_codes_middle method to add the rest of the visualisation

Parameters:
hierarchy_num - - the hierarchy that it will be placed in
Returns:
- true if everything is added properly

alpha_codes_middle

public double alpha_codes_middle(Hierarchy hierarchy,
                                 int level,
                                 java.lang.String parent_id,
                                 int left_padding,
                                 int index)
Add the contents to the seconds level of the hierarchy If there are more levels, then the function calls recursively. For the last level it calls the count function

Parameters:
hierarchy - - the hierarchy that it belongs t0
level - - its level in the hierarchy
parent_id - - its parent's id
left_padding - - the left padding to be added to the label
index - - index for the correct tableName
Returns:
- the number of objects that were counted

largest

public void largest(int index)
Gets the code with the largest count We are only interested in the number not the actual code A different query is formed based on the number of levels the table has

alpha_count

public java.lang.String alpha_count(java.lang.String id,
                                    int index)
A generic count for the codes We have the id of what we are searching and we will return its count

Parameters:
id - - the id we are counting
index - - the index for the tableName
Returns:
- the integer count value

interaction

public void interaction(boolean is_hover,
                        boolean is_entry,
                        boolean is_left_up,
                        AMLabel label)
This method takes care of the interaction that will take place We decide here if we are expanding or collapsing We also decide if we will highlight the items or not

Parameters:
is_hover - - if the event was a hover or not (not is a click event)
is_entry - - if it was an entry (hover or click) or an exit (hover or click)
is_left_up - - if the interaction was left or up, necessary for the exit conditions
label - - the label that was interacted with

perform_action

public void perform_action(Hierarchy hierarchy,
                           AMLabel label,
                           java.lang.String query,
                           boolean is_image,
                           boolean is_hover,
                           boolean is_entry,
                           boolean is_left_up)
Perform a generic action of this label This is made so that any function can call this method

Parameters:
hierarchy - - the hierarchy that the label lives in
label - - the label that was interacted with
query - - the query that needs to be executed
is_image - - if we interacted with an image or not
is_hover - - if it was a hover event or click
is_entry - - if it was an entry onto the label or an exit
is_left_up - - if the interaction was left or up, necessary for the exit conditions

connection

public void connection(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> list,
                       Hierarchy h3)
This method makes the connection between the levels This way if we interact with one panel then the rest will light up and show data As we have three panels, just need to perform the operations on the other two

Parameters:
list - - The list containing unique elements
h3 - - The panel that it originated from

from_to

public java.lang.StringBuffer from_to(java.lang.StringBuffer inputs,
                                      java.lang.String from,
                                      java.lang.String to)
Decides which query to be run when we have a starting set (the from) and the table we want to get to (the to) We decide which query we will use depending on the count type that is currently being used

Parameters:
inputs - - the elements that we want to find
from - - the table we are starting from
to - - the table we are ending with
Returns:
- the query that needs to be run to find the correct elements, with the count

looper

public void looper(Hierarchy hierarchy,
                   java.lang.String query)
Generic looper function Used to loop through the results for the connection between the panels Then calls the increment function to update the panel

Parameters:
hierarchy - - the hierarchy that we are looking at
query - - the query to be executed

increment_count

public void increment_count(AMLabel label,
                            java.lang.Double value,
                            javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> map,
                            boolean colour_only)
Increment the sub_count of a bar

Parameters:
label - - The label we want to increment
value - - The value we want the bar to be set to
panel - - The panel that it belongs to
map - - The hashmap that it is contained within
colour_only - - If we only want to colour the parents and not increment the bar

alpha_code

public java.lang.String alpha_code(AMLabel label,
                                   int index)
Get the correct query for the codes

Parameters:
label - - the label that was interacted with
index - - index for the correct tableName
Returns:
- the query to be executed

recount_top

public void recount_top(Hierarchy hierarchy)
Update the black bars after the count type has been changed for the top level

Parameters:
hierarchy - The hierarchy to be updated

recount_middle

public float recount_middle(Hierarchy hierarchy,
                            int level,
                            java.lang.String parent,
                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> map)
Count the middle level hierarchy. If more levels exist, function is called recursively

Parameters:
hierarchy - - the hierarchy that they reside in
level - - the level for the table
parent - - the parent for the for codes
map - - the Hashmap
Returns:
- the number of elements counted

count

public void count(java.lang.String option)
Update the counter / bar on all of the panels This occurs when an event is fired that changes the type of count As this is global all of the counts will be the same

Parameters:
option - - The option provided by the user
